summary: Cynthia Sue Cooper was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list her name, salary, and employment dates. She appears on the payroll for April 1978, August 1978, and December 1978. The documents do not specify her role within the committee, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member during the committee's investigation.
significance: Cynthia Sue Cooper's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, albeit in an unspecified role.
